clinical_study.brief_title: The Efficacy of Probe-based Confocal Laser Endomicroscopy in Staging OLGIM

brief_summary.textblock: Gastric intestinal metaplasia (GIM) is an important premalignant lesion for gastric cancer. Precisely surveillance of patients with GIM may result in early detection and improved prognosis. Though important, it is not necessary to recommend surveillance endoscopy for all patients with GIM, since the progression rate to gastric cancer within 10 years is only 1.8% in those patients.

primary_outcome.measure: the sensitivity of probe-based Confocal Laser Endomicroscopy (pCLE) in staging the Operative Link on Gastric Intestinal Metaplasia (OLGIM).
